Anecdote about Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il was present at an aesthetics seminar of writers and artistes in January Juche 59 (1970).
 A critic made a speech with words adopted from a foreign language. The participants could understand his speech because all of them were artistic experts.    
 But Kim Jong Il stopped his speech and criticized him of using borrowed words instead of home-grown words. He said it was a manifestation of the lack of the serve-the-people spirit to use words difficult for others to understand or words adopted from foreign languages.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam greets Joseph Kabila
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 18 sent a message of greetings to Joseph Kabila on his reassumption of office as President of the Democratic Republic of Congo according to the "comprehensive agreement" concluded through the national dialogue.
 Kim in the message wished the president new success in his responsible work for the sovereignty of the country, territorial integrity and national reconciliation and peace, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the future, too.
